model

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Jessie George, Karl Xu class for the chess piece

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String color
      color is the color of the piece (w or b)
      boolean enPassantRight
      enPassantRight is true if a piece currently has the right to do the enPassant move
      boolean hasMoved
      hasMoved is true if the piece has moved.

      • pieceIsWhite

        public boolean pieceIsWhite()
        method to check if the piece is white this method is used to make boolean logic shorter syntactically NOTE: you have to make sure that it's not an empty square before you use this method, depending on what context you're using it in. If you're calling it as a super function then you know piece exists so you don't need to check if square is empty. If you're calling it not as a super function like ChessSquare.piece.pieceIsWhite() then you need to check if the square is an empty tile or if it actually has a piece.
        Returns:
        true if the piece is white

      • setHasMoved

        public void setHasMoved(boolean b)
        assign value to hasMoved
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean to assign to hasMoved

      • getHasMoved

        public boolean getHasMoved()
        get hasMoved
        Returns:
        hasMoved

      • isValidMove

        public abstract boolean isValidMove(int fromRow,
                                    int fromCol,
                                    int toRow,
                                    int toCol)
        abstract method to check if the move is valid for a piece
        Parameters:
        fromRow - row you are moving from
        fromCol - column you are moving from
        toRow - row you are moving to
        toCol - column you are moving to
        Returns:
        true if it is a valid move
